intro: Persicaria affinis, commonly known as narrowleaf smartweed, is a herbaceous annual plant native to North America. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The leaves are lance-shaped, with a smooth upper surface and a hairy underside, and they are arranged alternately along the stem. Small clusters of pink to red flowers appear at the ends of the stems, blooming from midsummer to early fall. This plant thrives in moist soils and is often found in wetlands, ditches, and along stream banks.
